# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the `wrap_string` function that adheres to your requirements:
```julia
function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    
    for word in eachword(text)
        if !isempty(current_line) && (length(current_line) + length(word)) > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = ""
        end
        
        if isempty(current_line)
            current_line = string(word)
        else
            current_line *= " " * string(word)
        end
    end
    
    # Add the last line if it's not empty
    if !isempty(current_line)
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end
    
    return join(lines, "\n")
end
```

Example usage:
```julia
text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed auctor felis nec lacus ultrices."

wrapped_text = wrap_string(text)
println(wrapped_text)
```
This function will split the input text into lines with a maximum width of 10 characters.
